page.title: 13POLITICS
page.content: The villages have very often there own Parish Council.This body deals with local matters which would be difficult to deal with at the larger council meetings in the towns. The Parish Coucillors are elected at the local elections.The polling station in most villages being the primary school as in Hathern or the Village Hall. Any grievance a villager may have about property or matters in the village they would take to their Parish Councillor and he would bring it up at the next meeting of the council which in Hathern is held in the Community Centre attached to the school.
